intro: Galium parisiense proles decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive wood-rose, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
